jaxparrow.tools.tools module¶

jaxparrow.tools.tools.compute_coriolis_factor(lat: int | ndarray | MaskedArray) → ndarray | MaskedArray¶

Computes the Coriolis factor from latitudes

Parameters:

lat (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – latitude

Returns:

Coriolis factor

Return type:

Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]

jaxparrow.tools.tools.compute_spatial_step(lat: ndarray | MaskedArray, lon: ndarray | MaskedArray, bounds: Tuple[float, float] = (100.0, 10000.0), fill_value: float = 1000.0) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]¶

Computes dx and dy spatial steps of a grid defined by lat, lon. It makes use of the distance-on-a-sphere formula with Taylor expansion approximations of cos and arccos functions to avoid truncation issues.

Parameters:

  • lat (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – latitude

  • lon (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – longitude

  • bounds (Tuple[float, float], optional) – range of acceptable values, defaults to (1e2, 1e4). Out of this range, set to fill_value

  • fill_value (float, optional) – fill value, defaults to 1e12

Returns:

dx and dy spatial steps

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]
